summary: Completed frontend testing of ClickEstate new features: scroll animation fix, 'Become A Realtor' button in navigation, realtor application form, and admin Applications tab. All requested features are working correctly.

expected_failures.issue: Returns 'fetch failed' due to placeholder Supabase credentials

passed_tests: 'Become A Realtor' button visible in desktop navigation (data-testid='nav-become-realtor')
'Become A Realtor' button visible in mobile navigation menu
Clicking 'Become A Realtor' button scrolls to application section
Become a Realtor section exists (id='become-realtor', data-testid='become-realtor-section')
Application form has all required fields: first_name, last_name, email, phone, experience, plan
All form fields accept user input correctly
Plan dropdown has correct options (starter, pro, unlimited)
Submit Application button is present and clickable
Scroll animation fix working - 'Featured Properties' heading remains visible after scrolling
Scroll animation fix working - 'Premium Listings' heading remains visible after scrolling
GSAP toggleActions set to 'play none none none' - elements stay visible after scroll
Applications tab visible in admin navigation (data-testid='nav-applications')
Applications tab is clickable and switches view
context_for_next_testing_agent: All new features implemented in this iteration are working correctly: 1) Scroll animation fix with GSAP toggleActions='play none none none' keeps elements visible after scrolling, 2) 'Become A Realtor' button added to both desktop and mobile navigation, 3) Realtor application form with all required fields (first_name, last_name, email, phone, experience, plan), 4) Admin portal has Applications tab. Database operations return 'fetch failed' due to placeholder Supabase credentials - this is expected behavior.
mocked_api_note: MOCKED: Supabase database uses placeholder credentials, so database write operations (including realtor application submission) will fail with 'fetch failed' error. This is expected and documented.
